query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Poi che la carità del natio loco 2 mi strinse, raunai le fronde sparte 3 e rende’le a colui, ch’era già fioco.
query.result: 1 After the love of my native place 2 compelled me, I gathered the scattered leaves 3 and returned them to him who was already hoarse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 Indi venimmo al fine ove si parte 5 lo secondo giron dal terzo, e dove 6 si vede di giustizia orribil arte.
query.result: 4 Then we came to the end where the second 5 circle departs from the third, and where 6 one sees the horrible art of justice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 A ben manifestar le cose nove, 8 dico che arrivammo ad una landa 9 che dal suo letto ogne pianta rimove.
query.result: 7 To clearly describe the new things, 8 I say that we arrived at a plain 9 that banishes every plant from its bed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 La dolorosa selva l’è ghirlanda 11 intorno, come ’l fosso tristo ad essa; 12 quivi fermammo i passi a randa a randa.

Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Lo spazzo era una rena arida e spessa, 14 non d’altra foggia fatta che colei 15 che fu da’ piè di Caton già soppressa.
query.result: 13 The ground was a dry and thick sand, 14 made in no other way than that 15 which was once trodden down by Cato's feet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 O vendetta di Dio, quanto tu dei 17 esser temuta da ciascun che legge 18 ciò che fu manifesto a li occhi mei!
query.result: 16 O vengeance of God, how much you should be 17 feared by everyone who reads 18 what was revealed to my eyes!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 D’anime nude vidi molte gregge 20 che piangean tutte assai miseramente, 21 e parea posta lor diversa legge.
query.result: 19 I saw many herds of naked souls 20 who were all weeping very pitifully, 21 and it seemed that different laws had been imposed on them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Supin giacea in terra alcuna gente, 23 alcuna si sedea tutta raccolta, 24 e altra andava continüamente.
query.result: 22 Some people were lying supine on the ground, 23 some were sitting all huddled up, 24 and others were walking incessantly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Quella che giva ’ntorno era più molta, 26 e quella men che giacëa al tormento, 27 ma più al duolo avea la lingua sciolta.
query.result: 25 Those who were going around were the most numerous, 26 and those who were lying down suffered less torment, 27 but their tongues were more loosened to lament.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Sovra tutto ’l sabbion, d’un cader lento, 29 piovean di foco dilatate falde, 30 come di neve in alpe sanza vento.
query.result: 28 Over all the sand, with a slow fall, 29 dilated flakes of fire were raining down, 30 like snow in the Alps without wind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 31 Like Alexander saw in those hot regions 32 of India above his army 33 flames falling steadily to the ground,

34 per ch’ei provide a scalpitar lo suolo 35 con le sue schiere, acciò che lo vapore 36 mei si stingueva mentre ch’era solo:

49 E quel medesmo, che si fu accorto 50 ch’io domandava il mio duca di lui, 51 gridò: «Qual io fui vivo, tal son morto.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Rëa la scelse già per cuna fida 101 del suo figliuolo, e per celarlo meglio, 102 quando piangea, vi facea far le grida.
query.result: 100 Rhea once chose it as a safe cradle 101 for her son, and to better hide him, 102 when he cried, she had shouts made there.
